column1: Do you have a persistent cough lasting more than 2 weeks?
column2: Are you coughing up blood or blood-stained sputum?
column3: Do you experience night sweats regularly?
column4: Have you had an unexplained weight loss recently?
column5: Do you have a prolonged fever or fatigue?
column6: Have you been in close contact with a person who has TB?
column7: Have you previously been treated for TB?
column8: Have you traveled or lived in a region with high TB prevalence?
column10: Are you undergoing immune-suppressive treatment (e.g. cancer therapy)?
column12: Do you have chronic illnesses such as diabetes?
column14: Are you above 45 years of age?
